questions.question_text: Which of the following types of attacks is characterized by encrypting data and locking out a user from access to certain data within a workstation?
The process of searching for open or weakly secured wireless networks in a geographic area is known as:

discussion.content:
war driving—driving around with a mobile device
looking for open wireless access points with which to communicate and looking
for weak implementations that can be cracked (called WEP cracking or WPA
cracking). They then lead to war chalking—those who discover a way in to the
network leave signals (often written in chalk) on, or outside, the premise to
notify others that the vulnerability is there. The marks can be on the sidewalk,
the side of the building, a nearby signpost, and so on

questions.question_text: A technician discovers that multiple switches require a major update. Which of the following policies should be followed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the best answer
change management also lets others know what is going to be taking place so that in some cases users and admins can have the opportunity to be made aware of what to expect
just curious as to why the answer is A......can anyone elaborate please

comments.content: An update is a change, therefore change management would be the best answer. Updates have nothing to do with answer B or answer C, and answer D is a distraction.

discussion.content: In my experience Change Management is mainly used for getting new devices onto your network. If a switch needed to be upgraded/replaced, you would need to go through change management to install those new switches. Computer management can also be applied to softwares that aren't on your company's approved software list.

comments.content: technician perform on a regular schedule

Because patches and updates should be performed on a regular schedule so that the switches have the same security & functionality. Disabling unused ports is something that's done at the start of building a network and doesn't need to be done regularly.

discussion.content: Why C? Shouldn't this be D?

questions.question_text: A network technician notices that switches of the same model have different commands and security features while administering them. Which of the following hardening techniques should the technician perform on a regular schedule to ensure all switches have the same features and security functionality?

A network administrator has deployed a secure wireless network that authenticates using Active Directory network credentials so individual users are uniquely identified when connected to the WLAN. Which of the following wireless technologies has the administrator configured?

discussion.content: This is related to RADIUS, 802.1x enterprise
